column1: Janet bought 6 + 2 = 8 albums. She bought 8 * 9 = 72 songs from country albums. She bought 2 * 12 = 24 songs from pop albums. She bought 72 + 24 = 96 songs total.
Lana had 4 boxes * 2 scarves + 6 mittens = 16 pieces of winter clothing.
There were 40 + 23 = 67 shirts to wash. He washed 29 shirts so he did not wash 67 - 29 = 48 shirts.
9 tables * 7 women / table + 3 men / table = 63 customers / table
There are 64 - 36 = 28 students left. There would be 28 / 4 = 7 students in each group.
There are 32 - 12 = 20 pieces of candy left. She can make 20 / 5 = 4 piles.
3 - 27 = 10 pictures were in 3 different albums. So each album had 10 / 3 = 2 pictures.
He has to make 17 + 55 = 78 trips. Each trip he makes will take him 78 / 9 = 8 trips.
He won 3 + 5 = 8 tickets. He can buy 8 / 4 = 2 pieces of candy.
During the next 19 weeks, Manuel must save 500 - 177 = 323 dollars. Each week, he must save 323 / 19 = 21 dollars.
Tom still has 14 - 8 = 6 boxes of chocolate candy. This means he still has 6 * 3 = 18 pieces of chocolate candy.
